channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The costs of Israel's longest war, for Israelis
item.description: Israelis are paying heavy costs for the longest war in their history: a mental health crisis, trauma, unprecedented division during wartime, animosity...

item.title: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
item.description: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not ...

item.title: Democrats take legal aim at "the Radical Left" language during shutdown
item.description: Democrats and a federal union argue the Trump administration's language posted on federal agency websites and in some emails blaming the 'Radical Left...

item.title: The government shutdown is snarling air travel. Officials say it could get worse

item.title: These numbers show how 2 years of war have devastated Palestinian lives in Gaza
item.description: It's been two years since Hamas-led militants attacked Israel, killing some 1,200 people and taking 251 hostages. In response, Israeli leaders promise...

item.title: Excitement — and concerns — over OpenAI's Sora 2 and other AI video tools
item.description: Sora 2 and Meta's "Vibes" feature lets users' imagination run wild in creating online video. That could get messy, tech experts say.

item.title: Everest hikers guided to safety after being stranded by blizzard
item.description: Hundreds of hikers have been guided to safety in Tibet after becoming trapped over the weekend by heavy snowfall.

item.title: Dispute emerges over back pay for furloughed workers
item.description: The 2025 government shutdown entered its seventh day on Tuesday as both sides remained locked in their positions, with no sign of relenting. Follow li...

item.title: German mayor critically injured in stabbing attack, police say
item.description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz says "we fear for the life" of Iris Stalzer, a newly-elected mayor in the western town of Herdecke.

item.title: Israelis mark 7 October anniversary as talks on Gaza peace plan continue
item.description: "The horror of that dark day will be forever seared in the memories of us all," UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres said.

item.title: Five takeaways from Pam Bondi's tense, partisan Senate hearing
item.description: Nerves were raw in a hearing that covered much ground, and saw Trump's attorney general go on the attack.

item.title: Motorists lift medical helicopter to rescue woman after crash injuring 3 on California highway
Flights delayed at some airports amid air traffic controller shortage
item.description: Airports in several U.S. states are seeing flight delays as the government shutdown enters a second week.

item.title: Israelis mourn 2 years after Hamas attack as the Gaza war grinds on
item.description: As Israelis come together to mourn those killed two years ago by Hamas, the sounds of the ongoing war in Gaza reverberate over a solemn memorial.

item.title: Two Austrian women switched at birth meet 35 years later
item.description: Doris Grünwald and Jessica Baumgartner, born in Graz in 1990, were accidentally given to the parents of the other family.
